statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 4 \\ 1 \\ 0 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ -2 \\ -1 \\ 1 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 8 \\ -12 \\ -4 \\ 2 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -4 \\ 2 \\ 5 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 9 \\ -4 \\ -6 \\ 4 \\ 10 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent or linearly independent.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 4 \\ 1 \\ 0 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ -2 \\ -1 \\ 1 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 8 \\ -12 \\ -4 \\ 2 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -4 \\ 2 \\ 5 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 9 \\ -4 \\ -6 \\ 4 \\ 10 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent .
